result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Leslie Turbeville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today May 1, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM32.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM32.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested.

-Comply with all correctional programs as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to possess a firearm.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-No DNA sample.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Leslie Turbeville

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Paul Leslie Turbeville appeared. Case called at 3:05 pm. Court reviews file. Atty Nelson recites agreement. No objection from ADA Bork. Court amends charge to Disorderly Conduct. 947.01. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count 1. Court orders 1 year probation sentence w/h with conditions:
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge, no sample
- 30 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA, if requested by agent
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Comply with all correctional as directed by Agent
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Subject to Random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Report to Probation on May 1st, 2015
Plea hearing on May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
